Description: Head of terracotta figurine with grotesque features. Beige-yellow Nile silt clay, dense, some mica, traces of white dressing, with some pink or yellow added paint; mould-made, head solid, central round hole in neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, Glasgow. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Ptolemaic, 3rd or 2nd century BC parallels from Naukratis (British Museum (GR1886,0401.1427, GR1886,0401.1428, GR1886,0401.1412, EA1976,0724.2; Walters 1903, C 625; Bailey 2008, 151, pl. 106, nos 3573-3578; Ashmolean Museum, Oxford no. G 107; Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge, GR40.1887). One Naukratis parallel may be from the same mould series (Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 86.414). Egyptian comparanda, include similar examples dated 3rd to 2nd century BC (Török 1995, no. 241; Fischer 1994, no. 431, no. 437) and from a third century BC context at Athribis (Szymańska and Babraj 2004, 35, fig. 7). There are also similar 2nd century BC examples from Smyrna in Asia Minor (Burn & Higgins 2001, pl.71-2, no.2396-2404). Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth. Szymańska, H. & Babraj, K. 2004. 'Aus den Brennöfen von Athribis (Ägypten): Neue Funde aus dem Ptolemäischen Stadtviertel', in Antike Welt 35.2: 33-7. Török, L. 1995. Hellenistic and Roman terracottas from Egypt. Roma.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.520) (Phase 1)
